amendment.description: Amendment sought to remove $10 million in funding for energy conservation on military installations and increase funding for the Reliable Replacement Warhead program by $10 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 33 printed in House Report 110-666 to remove $10 million in funding for energy conservation on military installations and increase funding for the Reliable Replacement Warhead program by $10 million.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Pearce amendment (A007) Failed by recorded vote: 145 - 271 (Roll no. 358).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Pearce amendment (A007) Failed by recorded vote: 145 - 271 (Roll no. 358).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A007) offered by Mr. Pearce.
